statement.p: The path of a satellite orbiting the earth causes it to pass directly over two tracking stations A and B, which are 56 mi apart. When the satellite is on one side of the two stations, the angles of elevation at A and B are measured to be 86.8° and 84.7°, respectively.
statement.em: NOTE: The picture is NOT drawn to scale.
statement.p: How far is the satellite from station A?
How high is the satellite above the ground?

p.em: Enter your answer as a number; your answer should be accurate to 2 decimal places.
